betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The Naga Scales you have are not up to the task of holding together a Greatwood wand. You will need something better.

Your mentor tells you that having slain a Naga, and claimed both it's trophy and scale, you should be able to break the enchantment on the stone towers that house the Twilight's oldest, though not most powerful residents. These Liches, as your mentor calls them, tried and failed to infuse their bodies with runic magic. They did succeed, technically, they just didn't survive the process. Not entirely.

If you were to find and defeat one of these Liches, their bones should be able to handle the amount of Vis your Greatwood wand will control. The only problem is their twisted magic. You'll need a way to break their shield before you'll be able to damage them.

...Come to think of it, if these Liches are Thaumaturges - albeit, failures - you wonder if any of them hoarded items of value to a budding Thaumaturge? It might be worth taking a closer look around these towers...

Â§3Don't try to rush kill a Lich with a TiC rapier. That is not going to work in GTNH.
